message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.SI, cs.CL. 

The paper proposes a novel approach for graph representation learning using Graph Convolutional Networks (GCNs). This falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) as it involves learning representations from data. The approach involves adaptively selecting optimal neighbors for feature aggregation, which can be seen as a form of regularization (cs.AI). The method is evaluated on several datasets, including image datasets (cs.CV) and text datasets (cs.CL). Finally, the paper discusses the potential impact of graph structure noise on the fixed aggregation strategy used in existing GCNs, which falls under the category of signal processing (cs.SI).
